frontend.title: Junior Backend Developer
frontend.description: At RD Projekt, we develop enterprise software that enables organizations to realize the business value of the information they already possess. The companies that rely on our knowledge discovery and text mining solutions include industry leaders as NASA, HP, Johnson & Johnson, Boeing, Nike, Merck, Sony, BBC, and others. Our efforts thrive and serve many people.We will be a good fit if you value working in a small team adhering to agile methodology, and a cozy atmosphere. If you are looking for a place with smart, experienced individuals who enjoy sharing their knowledge, please apply! Don‚Äôt worry in case you are still studying - this can be a part-time job with flexible working hours, so you will have time to graduate.You will take part in the development of our text analytics and ontology management software. This part of our solution is built on the Java technology stack, running on Quarkus. The frontend part of the application has been implemented with React. We also use triple store (NoSQL) databases accessed through Apache Jena for datastorage, and C++ for some efficiency-critical parts.We would like you to have the following:‚óè Some experience with Java,‚óè Knowledge of REST interfaces,‚óè A bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field (can be in progress),‚óè Good English and Polish language skills,‚óè Willingness to once a month spend some time with a team (in Warsaw).Experience with other technologies would be a plus (React, Scala, Kotlin, Go, Rust, C++).What you can expect:‚óè A salary of 11 000 - 14 500 PLN net/month,‚óè Mandate contract (umowa zlecenie),‚óè Part-time or full-time job - depending on your needs - somewhere between 30-40 working hours per week will be fine for us,‚óè Flexible working hours to accommodate your studies if you need,‚óè The option to work remotely or from the office, wherever suits you best,‚óè A budget for training and conferences,‚óè Private healthcare coverage,‚óè Team parties and events in Warsaw,‚óè English lessons with a native speaker.Our recruitment process is entirely remote, and consist of:‚óè A short Google Meet with the Recruitment Manager followed by technical quiz,‚óè Online conversation with our CTO,‚óè On request - first-hand info from one of our Junior Backend Developers (s/he will tell you how it is to work with us)

Offer description About LegalZoom
We're here to make legal help accessible to all. LegalZoom transformed the legal industry with the¬†launch of our online services and groundbreaking technology in 2001. Since then, millions of¬†customers have counted on us to officially start and run businesses, protect brands and intellectualproperty, and look after loved ones through wills and trusts.
As the industry leader for over 20 years, innovation remains at the center of all we do. We're creative¬†thinkers and problem solvers with a passion for building legal and tax products that make a positive¬†impact on the world, and we're always looking for exceptional people to push us further.¬†With us, you'll do work that's as rewarding as it is challenging with a team where every voice matters¬†and diversity, equality, and inclusion are truly embraced. Together, we'll continue to democratize the¬†law and make a real difference in the lives of millions.
Overview
Your work is consistently of high quality. You solve difficult problems, applying appropriate technologies¬†and best practices. You work with your team to invent, design and build software that is stable and¬†performant. You write code that an Software Development Engineer unfamiliar with the system can¬†understand. Your solutions are pragmatic. You are proficient in a broad range of design approaches and¬†know when it is appropriate to use them (and when it is not). You do things with the proper level of¬†complexity the first time (or at least minimize incidental complexity). You consider the legacy of the code¬†you produce, limiting the use of short-term workarounds. You create flexible software withoutover-engineering. You make appropriate trade-offs, re-use where possible, and are judicious about introducing dependencies. read more

frontend.title: Lead/Senior Frontend Developer
frontend.description:
What you will doAre you a highly skilled and experienced Front End Developer seeking a senior or leadership role where you can make a significant impact? Look no further than jacando! Join our passionate tech team as a Senior or Lead Front End Developer and play a crucial role in shaping the future of our web applications and user interfaces. At jacando, we are actively seeking a talented and experienced Senior/Lead Frontend Engineer to join our dynamic team. As a key member, you will have a pivotal role in further developing and expanding our existing applications, as well as designing and implementing exciting new features. Your expertise will be instrumental in shaping our IT landscape as you architect innovative solutions, introduce cutting-edge concepts and technologies, and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.¬†


Shape the user experience: Collaborate closely with designers and product managers to craft intuitive and visually stunning interfaces that delight our users. Your meticulous attention to detail and design aesthetics will establish new industry standards.
Architect the future: Utilize your technical expertise to design scalable and maintainable frontend architectures. You will have the freedom to explore the latest web frameworks and emerging technologies, adopting solutions that enhance performance and drive innovation.
Lead and mentor: Inspire and guide a team of talented frontend engineers, unlocking their full potential. Your exceptional leadership skills and technical prowess will foster a culture of continuous learning, creativity, and collaboration.
Collaboration at its finest: Seamlessly collaborate with cross-functional teams, including backend engineers and product managers. Together, you will drive the development of our jacando software, shaping the future of HR.
Stay ahead of the curve: Keep your finger on the pulse of emerging frontend trends and technologies. Your passion for exploration and experimentation will ensure that we remain at the forefront of the ever-evolving web development landscape.

frontend.title: Frontend Developer (f/m/d) - onsite or rem...
frontend.description:
What you will doWith our strong brands GMX, WEB.DE and mail.com and over 42 million active users, we are the leading email and communications platform in Germany, Austria and Switzerland. From this strong market position, services and apps are developed that simplify users' digital lives - from office tools and cloud solutions to personal ID management.¬†

With a market share over 50 percent, GMX and WEB.DE are the most widely used e-mail providers in Germany. Including our international brands, we have more than 40 million active users. That's an achievement we are very proud of. It's a very rewarding feeling that our work has a direct impact on our friends and family, as the chances are high that some of them use our product and experience new features.
We strive to make the best Mail-Experience possible for our customers, and to make this happen we are looking for great frontend developers to join us and be part of the next chapter of our success story. Join our team of frontend experts in building the next-generation mail products based on modern technologies like JavaScript / TypeScript, CSS / SCSS, HTML, WebComponents, Redux, Stencil, Angular or React.
You can expect a diverse and talented team of passionate individuals who want to use their expertise to build the best customer product possible. Whether you prefer working in one of our offices in Munich or Karlsruhe or fully remote, we offer flexible working hours with a focus on a healthy work-life balance. Our cross functional product teams (that we call squads) offer a chance to have an impact in multiple stages of the product development from product discovery to implementing new features to existing products. A wide variety of trainings from tech related topics like security to soft skill topics like moderation as well as internal and external conferences give you the chance for continuous personal growth.

Work on new and existing products in the mail domain and solve challenging problems in the area of frontend development.
Design and implement technical solutions for real world customer problems, using state of the art web technologies, frameworks and tools like JavaScript / TypeScript, Redux, Stencil, Angular or React.
Interact daily with colleagues from different areas e.g. other frontend engineers, middleware engineers, quality assurance, user experience or product managers.
Own your codebase: Be part of architectural decision, write clean, maintainable as well testable code and bring in new ideas to improve the codebase and user features.
Stay up to date with the newest trends in the world of web technologies and share your knowledge in regular internal sessions.

About us:
We are currently seeking a Senior Fullstack .NET Developer to join our team in Warsaw, Poland focused on our core clinical systems as well as internal applications. Strong attention to detail, innovation, and implementation of new technologies are highly valued. We are expanding our existing office in Warsaw to build our first non-US software development center. Medpace is a full-service clinical contract research organization (CRO). We provide Phase I-IV clinical development services to the biotechnology, pharmaceutical and medical device industries. Our custom software is a key component to our success. You will be joining an organization where your contribution makes a significant impact in positively impacting people's lives, as new treatments and therapeutics are developed. More you can find on our webpage.This is an incredible opportunity to join, contribute, and grow with a new team, while also being a part of a large, fast-growing global organization.
Your responsibilities:
Create software applications by following software development life-cycle, which includes requirements gathering, design, development, testing, release, and maintenance.
Utilize skills in development areas including object oriented programming (C#), databases (SQL, EntityFramework) and web applications (Angular).
Collaborate with other software developers, product managers and testers.
Participate in shaping software development methodologies, tools and procedures.
Mentor other team members.
Propose architectural improvements.
Support the recruitment process.
Potential opportunities to lead software development projects.
Our requirements:
Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science.
At least 5 years of software development experience using technologies such as C#, Angular, Webservices, GraphQL, Git, Entity Framework, relational databases.
Understanding of software development life cycle (SDLC) and software release management.
Problem solving.
Team player.
Communication skills.
Nice to have:Experience in Azure DevOps and Azure Services.We offer:
Employment contract with a global full-service clinical contract research organization.
Great salary package.
Tax-Deductible Costs/Creative Tax ‚Äì claim deductible costs, reducing your income tax.
Local and global professional development opportunities, supported by Pluralsight platform.
Hybrid work-from-home options and flexible work schedule.
Modern office.
Medical and sport packages.

fullstack.title: Senior Java Developer
fullstack.description:
Our customer is the largest German insurance company and one of the biggest insurances across the world. They are now looking for a mature Fullstack Developer to enhance their development efforts, including developing new modules for insurance software and integration of existing services, freshly developed features and external services.We're expecting you to be a round-shaped specialist, proficient not only in writing code, but with understanding of architecture, system design, cloud infrastructure etc. You will play a key role in designing and creating new solutions that have to be flexible, highly performing and easily integrated.Responsibilities:
Take over end-to-end responsibility over the implemented software assets and maintain them in production (DevOps mindset - you build it, you run it)¬†
Be passionate about finding the sweet spot between building generic, reusable products and having a high pace in delivering a value add to our clients¬†¬†
Ensure fulfillment of non-functional requirements of the solution, such as performance, data protection, IT security and ergonomics/usability¬†
Understand and explain advantages and disadvantages of the proposed solutions to internal and external stakeholders, at different levels¬†¬†
Be accountable for the on-time and to-quality delivery of the software assets¬†¬†
Manage the design of deliverables and architecture with emphasis to efficiency, scalability, and reusability¬†
Requirements:
Master (MSc) or equivalent experience in a technical field (for example, Computer Science, Engineering...)¬†¬†
Expert knowledge and solid experience in Java, with a focus on Spring (v5+) and Spring Boot (v2+)
5+ years of experience in hands-on software engineering¬†
Knowledge of cloud-based platforms (preferable AWS)¬†¬†
Strong experience as a software developer in a medium/big environment (preferable in building a scalable API based applications)¬†¬†
Experience with common cloud tools / pattern (Kubernetes & Docker, Git & Jenkins, Kafka, relational databases, Camunda, Lambda functions etc.)¬†
Strong understanding of the Agile software development cycle.¬†
Excellent analytical, debugging, and problem-solving skills¬†¬†
Strong collaboration skills, ability to explore new paths and work in international teams¬†¬†
Experience working in cross-functional development teams using agile methodologies¬†¬†
A can-do attitude, result driven and openness to learning¬†¬†
Professional communication level in English (Upper-Intermediate or higher)
Nice to have:
Frontend experience (preferably with Angular 12+)
Knowledge of architectural patterns (microservices, streaming, process management, service decoupling and orchestration etc.)¬†¬†
We offer:
Competitive salary depending on your experience
Professional development opportunities
Study and practice of English: courses and communication with colleagues and clients from different countries
Yoga classes
Compensation package (paid vacation, sick leaves)
Flexible working hours (from 9-11 to 18-20)
Comfortable office or possibility to work remotely

Developed in close collaboration with our customers, our¬†SeaQ¬†portfolio encompasses design, integrated systems, marine electronics, and electrical systems. By utilizing our unique shipbuilder competence, we have created a high-quality product line that has been acknowledged by shipowners worldwide.The¬†SeaQ Portfolio¬†is divided into different segments:¬†‚Ä¢SeaQ Power ‚Äì A complete set of power solutions and components that generate, distribute and control power on board vessels.‚Ä¢ SeaQ Remote ‚Äì Transforming fleet operations with advanced remote technology. Centralized remote control of vessel functions.‚Ä¢ SeaQ Control ‚Äì A set of seamlessly integrated control systems, designed to improve usability and enhance the vessel‚Äôs performance at sea.‚Ä¢ SeaQ Bridge & Navigation ‚Äì Bridge Solutions based on smart technology, ensuring intuitive user interfaces, and seamless integration with maritime systems.‚Ä¢ SeaQ Communication ‚Äì A set of forward-thinking ICT solutions for marine vessels, providing ship owners with scalable and flexible solutions.Company website: https://www.vard.com/‚ÄòOur team is actively engaged in multiple development projects. Allocation of software team members to specific projects is contingent upon product requirements, individual competencies, and developer availability. In response to an escalated emphasis on product development, our operations are characterized by a dynamic and rapidly evolving landscape.‚Äô¬†List of technologies used in the project:‚Ä¢ Vue ‚Ä¢ JavaScript ‚Ä¢ TypeScript ‚Ä¢ Node.js ‚Ä¢ Java ‚Ä¢ Electron ‚Ä¢ MongoDB ‚Ä¢ Timescale ‚Ä¢ Docker ‚Ä¢ KubernetesJob summary‚Ä¢ Development of software solutions, mainly for products enabling remote technology and digitalization of vessels‚Ä¢ To provide technical advice for coworkers when needed‚Ä¢ Continuously improvement of relevant technology‚Ä¢ To take part in all development phases, from idea generation to seeing your solutions in useGeneral qualifications‚Ä¢ 5+ years or more work experience in software development‚Ä¢ Relevant higher education‚Ä¢ Relevant work experience may compensate for lack of higher education‚Ä¢ Preferable with experience from Atlassian (Confluence + Jira), Git and agile methodologiesTechnical Qualifications ‚Ä¢Java (must have)‚Ä¢Linux (OS used on all target devices and OS used by all developers)‚Ä¢Databases (Timescale, MongoDB)‚Ä¢DevOps (Kubernetes, Docker)‚Ä¢Cloud‚Ä¢Cyber SecurityWe are currently looking for a backend and frontend developers, but also we are possibly interested in hiring fullstack ones. If you are interested in a fullstack position as well, please see the full tech stack above.¬†Personal competencies‚Ä¢ Independent, resourceful, and eager to learn‚Ä¢ Has a passion for technology‚Ä¢ Can solve tasks independently and take responsibility when required‚Ä¢ Strives to make themselves and everyone around them better‚Ä¢ Having the will and ability to solve problems in a hectic environment‚Ä¢ Team player‚Ä¢ Structured¬†At Conscensia we offer:‚Ä¢ B2B Contract with a fixed monthly rate with 20 days of holidays included, fully paid bank holidays and sick leaves‚Ä¢ Long term engagement with the possibility to develop competencies and career path‚Ä¢ Salary 27 000 ‚Äì 36 000 PLN net/month depending on your technical level‚Ä¢ Office located near Rondo ONZ in Warsaw‚Ä¢ Hybrid model of cooperation (2 days from the office a week)‚Ä¢ Danish work culture‚Ä¢ Medical insurance‚Ä¢ Multisport card‚Ä¢ Annual performance appraises
